WRITING.TITLE: Work around for Blender .fbx export's force start/end keying?
WRITING.TEXT: Hi I'm exporting a .gltf file from .blend. However since the gltf exporter isn't supporting exporting animations, we need to first export .fbx file from Blender, then re-import in Blender, then export .gltf. During the .fbx export, if I don't check force start/end keying, the actions would be exported differently; if I check it, there'll be some strange 90 degree rotation and scale won't work properly in the .gltf format. I wonder if there's any workaround for the force start/end keying? Appreciate it.
doesn't export properly

yes, if you export to fbx then reimport it to blender then push down then export to gltf, the animations are correct. The only thing is the 90 degree rotation which is related to fbx's x axis rotation problem. I opened an issue under Khronos' repo a month ago, they say they fixed it and closed the issue, however the latest package still export animations incorrectly.
lol, ok I'll try. Thanks.

WRITING.TITLE: How to register 3d model.
WRITING.TEXT: Hello, compared to the flooded makeup tutorials, I found zero demo of registering a 3D model other than Matlab's point cloud registering/stitching. However it only plots the vertex locations, no coordinates of the triangles, materials, none all that. Here is a 1sec model tri.ply in Blender, and the plotted in Matlab through `ptCloud = pcread('tri.ply'); pcshow(ptCloud)` https://preview.redd.it/s5n94oz5gyi31.jpg?width=1912 amp;format=pjpg amp;auto=webp amp;s=710fd0be263993d23bd66362492b518e7a90e967 What I'm trying to achieve is to label my own dataset, similar to [BaselFaceModel](https://faces.dmi.unibas.ch/bfm/index.php?nav=1-0 amp;id=basel_face_model) , but not faces. If anyone knows how to achieve it, please let me know. Python preferred. Appreciate it. \----Update: Found a software called [Meshlab](http://www.meshlab.net/), try it out and see if it's able to label the data points. Also looks like I misunderstood the purpose of 'registration', which is to align two different models (why?).

Thanks. Here's what I'm trying to do: 1. Perform some operations on different 3d models (also segment their regions. label features,etc), and get a 'base morphable model'(as a template). the morphable model should store all the info-- vertex\_num, (x,y,z), (x,y), segments, triangles, etc. 2. Align it's labeled 3d features to corresponding 2d images. As I understand, PCA is used to down-dimensionize data, ICP is for aligning 2 pointclouds. Say I have i.e 3d cat mesh A, B, C, and I perform ICP on A to B to C, it'll deform A to B to C, then get the transformations between them. But then how to get the base morphable model? Also it treats the 3d mesh as pointcloud, so where does the triangle info go? (please excuse me if I get anything wrong as it's real far from my expertise)

Thanks. 1. By annotating the model, you meant marking certain vertex or vertices as a feature point(s) or segmentation? Do you happen to know which tool is able to achieve it? 2. Basically the process for morphable model is to align the new input 3d mesh data against template such as SMPL or custom made template, to get the transformation parameters, then use these parameters to morph the template? I assume the alignment require both models to have same amount of vertices. What if it is impossible to make sure the models have same amount of verts? ( use some averaging methods? [https://www.researchgate.net/publication/4023044\_3D\_Model\_Retrieval\_With\_Morphing-Based\_Geometric\_and\_Topological\_Feature\_Maps](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/4023044_3D_Model_Retrieval_With_Morphing-Based_Geometric_and_Topological_Feature_Maps) ) If I remember correctly, voxel isn't able to produce high res reconstruction and computationally expensive. Again, appreciate your help!
Amazing, found a way to extract the landmarks/annotate the model in Blender! :)))))))))

Compared to U.S, yes. Compared to other South Asia, no. The labor increased dramatically during the past years. Unless Google has a huge sales market in China, it has no reason to manufacture there in the first place.

What I meant was Google shouldn't have MANUFACTURED pixels in China when they DON'T have a market there. Or they could manufacture there and try to open up the market. There are two reasons you shall choose to manufacture oversea: 1. Significantly cheap labor. 2. Huge market oversea. Google has neither in China. However moving elsewhere is not going to help their sales neither.
$800/m in China? That's some huge gap compared to those who work in Huawei getting paid $300k+/y, $30k+ bonus.

GDP per capita is probably 1. Be dragged down by the population. If one makes less than $600/m, then he/she is eligible for government welfare. Average annual income per person in big cities is around $40k, could vary across cities. 2. The official income you find excludes the extra income other than salary from entity. For example, if you work for a company during the day, but make money from selling products or stocks, the latter aren't considered as your income. Therefore, the GDP per capita could be low.

WRITING.TITLE: [PCA] how to get eigenvalues using np.linalg.svd()
WRITING.TEXT: Hello, I'm practicing on pca, but I don't quite know how to get the eigenvalues correctly using np.linalg.svd(). Code below and appreciate the help in advance: import numpy as np from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler def compute_pca(data): #Input: m x n data matrix scaler = StandardScaler() scaler.fit(data) data=scaler.transform(data) mean = data.mean(axis=1)[:,np.newaxis] centered_matrix = data - data.mean(axis=1)[:,np.newaxis] cov = np.dot(centered_matrix, centered_matrix.T) [u,s,v] = np.linalg.svd(cov) pcs = [np.dot(centered_matrix.T, item) for item in u.T ] pcs = np.array([d / np.linalg.norm(d) for d in pcs]) pcs=pcs[:,:-1]
np.linalg.eig() returns imaginary number on my data matrix.
sure, but **np.linalg.svd()** doesn't give me imaginary number.

What do you mean by loading time? Initial loading time or loading time for each session? The official Tensorflow serving installation doc only provided instruction for Debian system, but what about windows, should I install docker first?

WRITING.TITLE: rotate vertices around a vector
WRITING.TEXT: Hi, how do I rotate a vector(x,y,z) for certain angle around a vector? Been looking for a way to build a rotation matrix, misrouted to Quaternions, and still have no clue. Here's what I have: a = [ 4 5 6]; b = [17 8 9]; % target rotationAxis = cross(a,b); vectorAngle = vector_angle(a,b); % How to rotate around rotationAxis for certain angle? function [angle] = vector_angle(v1, v2) v1_u = v1 / norm(v1); %unit vector v2_u = v2 / norm(v2); tmp_dot = dot(v1_u, v2_u); tmp_dot(tmp_dot gt;1.0) = 1.0; tmp_dot(tmp_dot lt;-1.0) = -1.0; angle = acos(tmp_dot);

WRITING.TITLE: Sparse matrix
WRITING.TEXT: For a sparse matrix M #65292; each row is a triangle, each column is an edge that connects to two triangles, M(i,j) = 1 if triangle i is connected to edge j, otherwise M(i,j) = 0. How do I make one triangle that connects to edge j to be 1, and the other connected triangle to be -1? For example the full matrix shall look something like this(sum of each column is 2): 0 0 1 0 1 ....0 1 1 0 1 0 ....0 1 0 1 0 0 ....0 0 1 0 1 1 ....1 ... ..............1

kind of. Not that big, more like 10\^5 x 10\^5. Each edge is only connected to two triangles, so only two non-zero elements in each column. Not tridiagonal. Edit #65306; You might understand it as InnerEdge-triangle adjacency matrix.
yes, one 1 should be 1, the other 1 should be -1.
Something like this? \[r, c\] = find(M); for i = 1:length(r) if rem(i,2)==0 edgePolygonAM(r(i),c(i))=1; else edgePolygonAM(r(i),c(i))=-1; end end
what is I(2:2:end) doing?
Ic. it's taking the even numbers. thanks.

WRITING.TITLE: Is there a way to get the polygon list from an adjacency matrix?
WRITING.TEXT: Is there a way to get the polygon list from an adjacency matrix? For example, given an adjacency matrix T: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7 v8 v9 v10 v1 1 1 v2 1 1 v3 1 1 v4 1 1 v5 1 1 1 v6 1 1 1 v7 1 1 v8 1 1 v9 1 1 v10 1 1 The polygon list is (Update: adjacency list) f 1 2 4 5 3 f 6 7 9 10 8

Yes I think it should be using find. But what should I be finding? It works on triangulated mesh to find sum(output=2). But it won't work in such case where number of each polygon's sides is different.

Adjacency matrix A: each row is a vertex, each column is a vertex, if there's connection between vertex i and vertex j, A(i,j) = 1. Otherwise 0. I didn't add the 0s for visually simplification. The polygon list is using vertex indices to represent connections. For example, f 1 2 5 4 3 means vertex 1 2 5 4 3 are connected to form the 1st face/polygon Yes, directly from my answer and input, there's no correlation. But if you use a pen to draw out the adjacency matrix input- make a line to connect the two vertices when A(i,j)= 1, you can get the same answer. But I think there should be an automatic way to get it.
This might be a good short video. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LUDNz2bIjWI](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LUDNz2bIjWI)
Think that can decide the components of the entire graph, but it can't get to the polygon connection list.

No, those are too far. I'm thinking about the connectivity list. It should do two things: 1. find the number of polygons in the graph. 2. find the members(vertex number) of each polygon. Components is a different thing. In my example, vertex 5 is connected to vertex 6, but it's only an edge, so the graph contains two polygons, both of 5 edges. But the graph only has one component because of the connection between vertex 5/6

This is exactly what Im looking for [https://mathematica.stackexchange.com/questions/18514/finding-face-vertices-from-the-face-adjacency-graph](https://mathematica.stackexchange.com/questions/18514/finding-face-vertices-from-the-face-adjacency-graph) . Unfortunately I don't understand that language.

WRITING.TITLE: Array index
WRITING.TEXT: Say I have matrix A = \[2.0 0.5 0.8; 1.0 1.3 1.6; 2.0 2.1 0.3; 3.4 5.2 3.1; 1.2 0.1 3.5; 0.9 0.8 0.3\]; b=\[2 3 5 6\]; then make another matrix B = A(b,:), so B = \[1.0 1.3 1.6; 2.0 2.1 0.3; 1.2 0.1 3.5; 0.9 0.8 0.3\]; Now I have another matrix C = \[2 3 5; 3 5 6; 1 5 6\]. C(i,j) is referring to A(C(i,j),:). i.e C(1,1) refers to A(2,:) For each element in C, how can I get the index of A(C(i,j),:) in B? i.e the C(1,1) refers to A(2,:), and A(2,:) has index of 1 in B. the indices of referred element in B from C should be D = \[1 2 3; 2 3 4; 1 3 4\]
OMG, yes! Why didn't I think of that. Many many thanks!!!
Yes I made a typo in C(3,1). Your code works well, thanks !
Think #8216;skeleton #8217; describes it better.

WRITING.TITLE: Untriangulate a triangulated mesh.
WRITING.TEXT: Hi, anyone knows how to untriangulate(img on right) a triangulated mesh(left)? Say we have vertices list of xyz coordinates and edges list and faces list. https://preview.redd.it/rfybqjrz21w31.jpg?width=2817 amp;format=pjpg amp;auto=webp amp;s=d225ca67ca5bed2504a8316b6b0646af645f9b50
I'd like to generalize it on any given triangulated mesh. Feel like it should involve walking the edges and finding the edge inside a quad then removing it.

not really. i.e. Removing the top edge of the triangle to the left-est will remove the triangle, leaving n-1 triangles and an extra edge. So only the right edge of this triangle can be removed. Also if more edges are removed, it'll leave ngons instead of quads.
And the vertices of two adjacent tris of the edge shall belong to the same plane. Thanks.

WRITING.TITLE: Closest connected edges to arbitrary graphical shape on 2D mesh?
WRITING.TEXT: Hi, is there a way to find the closest connected edges to arbitrary graphical shape such as green line on a 2D mesh? Thanks in advance for pointing the directions.
Well no, circle is closed shape. For non-complex open shape such as an open curve, each point P should just have one symmetrically mirrored point over the edge curve.
gt; (sum over x_i for i =1:n) Thank you. You mean sum of x_i for i = 1:n ? And what is the '*' at the end of each equation? Also the equations are for straight lines, but what about curves?
I think if you scale the edge curve from its center to the location where P'L = PL, that's how you find the symmetrically mirrored point for the corner points.
Oh, so you're 'slicing' the continuous green curve into small lines and use that to match the edge in 2D mesh. Very interesting, let me play with it. thank you very much!
Voronoi diagram from the green points? why? I'm not quite getting it.
If you meant '1-2-3-4...' by linear, then yes.
I c, but what if the closest vertex form a jumpy connection or it doesn't belong to original topology?
gt;single covering path Could you please explain a bit more on this? thanks.
yes, a polyline.
Thanks, let me look into TSP. But how do you find the cell the green points belong besides using eyes?
In your example, each point connects to exactly two edges. i.e. P2 only connects to P1/P3, is there a reason for that? Why not also connect P2 to P4 or P6?
I wonder what's the difference between voronoi cell and knn?
thank you for the additional info:)

WRITING.TITLE: Subtract a number for each selected element in a column
WRITING.TEXT: I want to subtract 1349 for each element in B2:B16 and fill B29:B43 with (1349-newNumbers). What's the easiest way to do that? https://preview.redd.it/d9ovps4425641.jpg?width=458 amp;format=pjpg amp;auto=webp amp;s=c264b07f621617b4907086c858316bd5f5b93100
newNumbers are the subtracted numbers of B2:B16 by 1349, should be 192, 425, 469.....

WRITING.TITLE: How to calculate length of 3D bezier curve of degree n
WRITING.TEXT: How to calculate length of 3D bezier curve of degree n. Here's where I am n = size(vertices,2)-1;% vertices: 3x(n+1). curve P(t) t=0:0.001:1; x=[];y=[];z=[]; x=(1-t).^(n)*vertices(1,1); y=(1-t).^(n)*vertices(2,1); z=(1-t).^(n)*vertices(3,1); for j=1:n w=factorial(n)/(factorial(j)*factorial(n-j))*(1-t).^(n-j).*t.^(j); x=x+w*vertices(1,j+1);y=y+w*vertices(2,j+1);z=z+w*vertices(3,j+1); end [This](https://imgur.com/a/UYZ2uuN) is what I'm trying to do

analytical solution. Yes I figured there're two terms(?) i and t in the function, not sure how can I do definite integral on two. But how do you convert it to monomial? There's a javascript implementation seems to be able to do it, but I'm not a programmer to understand it. https://github.com/Pomax/bezierjs/blob/master/lib/utils.js

joint point is the end point of c1 and start point of c2.

WRITING.TITLE: Understanding manifolds

In this paper, https://www.researchgate.net/publication/228566346_Construction_of_C_Surfaces_from_Triangular_Meshes_Using_Parametric_Pseudo-Manifolds , it uses a parametric psuedomanifold to construct a triangular mesh to C(infinite) continuity. I #8217;m wondering can the points #8217; global coordinates on the surface be computed?
Akin to global coordinates, so basically manifolds don #8217;t have the properties for manufacture compared to B-spline surfaces?

WRITING.TITLE: How to reinstall Windows over Ubuntu (Dell PC)
WRITING.TEXT: Hello, I accidentally wiped out my entire Windows when trying to install Ubuntu from live USB. Right now I want to get my Windows back. Dell support sent me a link https://www.dell.com/support/home/en-us/drivers/osiso/recoverytool/wt64a to download Windows OS ISO and Dell Recovery Tool, then install the recovery tool and use it to create a bootable USB recovery drive. But the DellOSRecoveryTool is .msi format, i can #8217;t open it in Ubuntu. Should I be doing something different?

I have backed up everything. Right now there #8217;s only Ubuntu on my Dell pc, so I #8217;d like to do a clean reinstall of Win10. But I can #8217;t open DellOSRecoveryTool.msi from Ubuntu using the installation guide provided by my Dell support.

What is DD command ? I have no idea how to use Ubuntu at all, can #8217;t even have my wireless mouse connected. Also the only other pc I have is a Mac, which I don #8217;t think I can use it here. The etcher is the one in Balena.com/etcher ?

I #8217;m using Etcher, should be similar to WoeUSB right? I can #8217;t flash the .iso image to my USB. It says #8216;Missing partition table. It looks like this is not a bootable image. The image does not appear to contain a partition table, and might not be recognized or bootable by your device #8217;. Let me try woeusb.

Yes, I #8217;m using WoeUSB now, having it run its course, so far so good. After this, can I use it on the same device? In the tutorial, it says #8216; once done you can close the app, eject the usb and use it to install Windows 10 on a different device #8217;

I changed BIOS sequence (unchecked #8216;diskette Drive #8217; and let the #8216;internal HDD #8217; be the first), should I change it back so #8216;diskette drive #8217; is checked and be the first? Update: I restored all the BIOS sequence(legacy and UEFI), and got into windows installer and chose #8216;custom: install Windows only(advanced). There #8217;re two partitions on my internal HDD(drive 0 partition 1 amp; drive 0 partition2), but my USB isn #8217;t listed here. So I should just delete both partitions right? Update2: after I deleted drive 0 partition0, it became #8216; Drive 0 Unallocated Space #8217; and it still says #8216;Windows can #8217;t be installed on this drive. Windows cannot be installed to this disk, the selected disk had an MBR partition table. On EFI system, Windows can only be installed to GTP disks. #8216; Update3: I removed both partition and warnings are gone, i got to proceed to windows setup and complete the setup, which automatically restarts after finishing. I leave the USB connected and press F12 upon seeing logo,, then it #8217;ll take me to boot selection where I can see 4 selections. (Legacy boot: )internal HDD, USB Storage Device. (UEFI Boot: )UEFI: Hard Drive, Partition 2. UEFI: SanDisk, partition 1. Which one should I choose?

After completing windows setup, I leave the USB connected and press F12 upon seeing logo, then it #8217;ll take me to boot selection where I can see 4 selections. (Legacy boot: )internal HDD, USB Storage Device. (UEFI Boot: )UEFI: Hard Drive, Partition 2. UEFI: SanDisk, partition 1. Which one should I choose?

If I remove USB it #8217;ll briefly install Windows then restart and enter a black screen that says #8216; No boot device found. Press any key to continue #8217; and repeat this message if I press any key. So I have to connect the USB stick and press f12 every time it restarts. (Oh the 3rd boot option changed from #8220;(UEFI Boot:) UEFI: Hard drive #8221; to #8220;(UEFI Boot:) Windows Boot Manager #8221; after the 2nd restart). Anyway the installation completed and I can finally use Win10 now. Do you know where can I set the boot option to be Windows Boot Manager as the default/first choice ?
I think you meant #8216;Boot sequence #8217;, they are: Diskette Drive, internal HDD, USB storage Device, CD/DVD/CD-RW Drive, Onboard NIC. Which one should be first?
Yes! I moved internal HDD to be first and select UEFI, now I can boot into Windows without USB stick! Thank you so much!!!

(it #8217;s my favorite USB with a flipped credit card design and Van Gogh portrait printed on it, also this make is discontinued)
Yeah, I tried it on my Mac, erased it and it works now! Thank you!

WRITING.TITLE: Intel Optane(tm) Memory Pinning: unable to load DLL #8216;iaSatirAfsServiceApi.dll #8217;
WRITING.TEXT: After I reinstalled Win10, I kept getting an error: Intel Optane(tm) Memory Pinning: unable to load DLL #8216;iaSatirAfsServiceApi.dll #8217;: the specifies module could not be found(exception from RESULT: 0x8... #8217; I was advised to reinstall Windows following this tutorial. https://www.dell.com/support/article/en-sg/sln309663/how-to-install-windows-10-when-intel-optane-is-installed-on-a-dell-pc?lang=en Instead I chose to repair the Intel Optane program from Control Panel/Programs/ since it #8217;s easier, and the error is gone. However a software I #8217;m using - Autodesk Alias isn #8217;t quite functioning properly. By that I mean it often freezes at the start of the software, sometimes I can use it after a few minutes, sometimes it remains dead, which never happened before. So my question is: is this problem a result of the Intel Optane although the error is gone? If so is there really no easy way around but to reinstall Windows completely?

WRITING.TITLE: Rowing for beginners.
WRITING.TEXT: My gym just got a Concept 2 rowing machine and I #8217;d like to get onto it. 1st round I did 4 minutes 150 stokes(level 5). 4 min later I did 2nd round for 1.5 minute 50 strokes. 3rd round I did 1.75 min for 75 strokes. Last round I did 5 minutes 180 strokes, then I #8217;m dead. I feel like I was doing it a bit too fast that exhausted me that much, but it #8217;s a little difficult to manage the pace to around 25 strokes/min when you gotta pull fast to make sure it works well. Also some articles say you gotta keep on it for like 30-40 min, but I can #8217;t really imagine anybody can be on it for 30min. What #8217;s the best plan to build it up eventually? Update: Just found two blisters on my right palm near the fingers, I actually was wearing gloves...
Thanks for the video. The guy releases quite slow, maybe just beginner advice. Also his arms move in a triangle from side view(dip when releases), where mine was almost straight line.
My cardiovascular endurance is terrible, that #8217;s why I need to build this up.

Thanks for the great advice. Let me look for the /500m next time, didn #8217;t know what it means. There was another number on top right, something like s/m. Was that important? It #8217;ll be nice if it has something to monitor the strokes too.
Ohhh! For some reason I thought it meant sec/min which doesn #8217;t make any sense.
Feel the hamstring first when leaning forward then bend knees?

Basically you gotta use butt, legs(hamstring/calves), lats to push away. What about the percentage of strength you gotta put on the different muscles? I can feel my lats and butt, not much on calves and hamstring. And I #8217;m certainly using too much of biceps. Also what #8217;s the difference between quads and hamstring, thought they were the same thing? And yes the front of feet are shifting away from the plate, definite need to correct my form.

I #8217;m trying to build up cardiovascular endurance, a healthier and stronger body, no need to lose weight or build muscles. But my knees are bad and I can #8217;t swim, which eliminates lots of options for me.
The best split time I can keep at is 2.45min, which muscles are the bottleneck here?
It's a brand new SanDisk Ultra Flair 128G. Is it possible that something bad happened during writing persistent data with Rufus?
The USB ports are fine, I can transfer data to WD drives. If I remove and re-plugin the live USB and reboot my laptop, occasionally I'll get lucky and be able to boot into Ubuntu.

WRITING.TITLE: Persistent live USB vs. Installed Ubuntu on USB drive - Graphic Cards
WRITING.TEXT: My laptop(Win 10) has an Nvidia Quadro M1200 and a built-in Intel HD 630. In a Ubuntu persistent live USB session, System Setting/Details lists my graphic card as `Intel #174; HD Graphics 630 (Kaby Lake GT2)` but I can choose '`Use Nvidia binary driver version 384.130 from nvidia 384 (proprietary, tested)`' in Software amp; Updates/Additional Drivers. Considering that I intend to install tensorflow-gpu later to use my Nvidia graphic card, I'd like to know what's the difference between persistent live usb and a full install regarding the graphic cards and which one is the best fit for me?

A noticeable drop in performance regarding storage? You mean live usb is faster cuz it's on RAM, and full install is slower ? But if I use a SSD as full install USB, it'll be fast too? 128G liveUSB vs. a 32G full install on USB stick, will the latter be a lot slower ?
What if I work with the files from SSD, will liveUSB(normal USB) and full install (normal USB) be different ?

Ok, let me look into it.

WRITING.TITLE: How to install Ubuntu on USB from Windows.
WRITING.TEXT: I'm trying to create a full Ubuntu install on a USB from Windows following this tutorial [https://ubuntu.com/tutorials/create-a-usb-stick-on-windows](https://ubuntu.com/tutorials/create-a-usb-stick-on-windows) After the USB is created, I boot into the USB and see couple options. 1. Try Ubuntu without install 2. Install Ubuntu. 3...4... Should I choose option 2? And in the following Ubuntu install GUI, there're couple options: 1. install with Windows Boot Manager 2. erase disk and install Ubuntu 3...4...5. Something else... Should I choose option 1 or 5 here?

I installed following this guide, http://ubuntuhandbook.org/index.php/2014/11/install-real-ubuntu-os-usb-drive/ I think it's the same thing. But when I plug the USB to my PC and boot into it, I can't access my internal SSD. It says unable to mount or something.

WRITING.TITLE: Can I make an ISO image of my Ubuntu installed on external USB and burn it to another USB?
WRITING.TEXT: I have Ubuntu installed on an external USB along with bunch of software. Today I get a new SSD and I'm wondering if I can make an ISO image of Ubuntu on USB and burn it to my SSD to save me some installation time ?
Cool, let me check out. Thanks.

In my case, I have an Ubuntu USB, and I need a second USB to burn i.e. Clonezilla image to, then I'll unplug Ubuntu USB, plug in Clonezilla USB and enter Clonezilla live, then plug in Ubuntu USB and my external SSD (target) to my pc, choose Ubuntu USB as source, SSD as target to finish the clone?
So if my Ubuntu USB is 128G, and my destination SSD is 250G, I'll only end up with 128G on Ubuntu SSD ?

Do you have a link to article/tutorial on how to do this? Something like this [https://www.howtogeek.com/114503/how-to-resize-your-ubuntu-partitions/](https://www.howtogeek.com/114503/how-to-resize-your-ubuntu-partitions/) ? Will the rest of the space be unallocated? If so I can just add partitions to it?

I cloned it, but it keeps saying #8216; No boot device found, press any key to reboot the machine #8217; when I reboot....and I can #8217;t find the file system in bios setup neither. Any idea what #8217;s going on? Should I format the ssd to fat32 first?
I #8217;m using this. https://youtu.be/XvIEuANr_1E Basically make a clonezilla liveusb, boot to it, clone from source USB to target SSD. I don #8217;t see how this can be wrong.

Yes, I tried again following the exact steps from the link you posted, still the same. There #8217;re something different running in the background than the tutorial shows tho, something like there #8217;s another boot loader and no grub so skipping grub. I don #8217;t know what #8217;s the problem. Here #8217;re some screenshots. https://ibb.co/5GhPznb https://ibb.co/0XdzL4x https://ibb.co/tXm3T8w Yes, after clone is finished, I unplugged other drives and only leave one connected.
EFI/legacy should have no problem. I #8217;m consistent there on EFI. What #8217;s even stranger is that the SSD doesn #8217;t even show up at the bios when I reboot.

WRITING.TITLE: M.2 NVMe SSD not recognized by BIOS
WRITING.TEXT: Hello, I installed Ubuntu system on a brand new M.2 NVMe SSD(with an enclosure) using [this tutorial](http://ubuntuhandbook.org/index.php/2014/11/install-real-ubuntu-os-usb-drive/) from my Dell (Precision 5520 Quadra M1200, installed with Win10). Then I connect the SSD (w enclosure) to type-c port of my dell pc, reboot the machine to BIOS, but SSD doesn #8217;t show at BIOS UEFI. I #8217;ve tried so many different methods including changing SATA Operation from RAID to AHCI, changing Boot sequence, etc. Nothing works. All I know is that the machine can recognize the SSD since I can install Ubuntu onto it from Dell pc, but the BIOS can #8217;t. Does anyone know what #8217;s going on and may help me out here? Appreciate it.

WRITING.TITLE: M.2 NVMe SSD not detected by BIOS
WRITING.TEXT: Hello, I installed Ubuntu system on a brand new M.2 NVMe SSD(with an enclosure) using [this tutorial](http://ubuntuhandbook.org/index.php/2014/11/install-real-ubuntu-os-usb-drive/) from my Dell (Precision 5520 Quadra M1200, installed with Win10). Then I connect the SSD (w enclosure) to type-c port of my dell pc, reboot the machine to BIOS, but SSD doesn #8217;t show at BIOS UEFI. I #8217;ve tried so many different methods including changing SATA Operation from RAID to AHCI, changing Boot sequence, etc. Nothing works. All I know is that the machine can recognize the SSD since I can install Ubuntu onto it from Dell pc, but the BIOS can #8217;t. Does anyone know what #8217;s going on and may help out here? Appreciate it.
No I didn #8217;t change to legacy. I installed Ubuntu in uefi and boot in uefi.
Legacy options Roms is enabled.
No I don #8217;t see the device.

Believe it or not, I #8217;ve tried it already, it #8217;s the same. Ubuntu isn #8217;t the problem here. I think the only suspects left are BIOS and type-c. Something is stoping BIOS from detecting name ssd, or typec isn #8217;t good for bootable disk.

WRITING.TITLE: M.2 NVMe SSD isn #8217;t detected by BIOS
WRITING.TEXT: Has anyone encountered a problem that M.2 NVMe SSD isn #8217;t detected by BIOS although the machine recognizes it? My machine is installed with Win10 on SATA drive, I have Ubuntu OS on NVMe ssd, I #8217;d like to choose which OS to boot to in BIOS when I connect NVMe ssd (w enclosure) to my machine, but it just won #8217;t show up. When I boot to Win10 and open disk management, the NVMe ssd disk is there along with all the correct partitions. I #8217;ve been trying to figure this out for a day, right now I have no clue. The BIOS UEFI mode is consistent to how the OS was made, legacy Option ROMs is enabled, update BIOS, if I reinstall the OS and it #8217;ll end up with the same problem, etc. What else can be the problem?!
Press F12 will enter BIOS, the NVMe ssd isn #8217;t visible. I #8217;ve been trying everything, it #8217;s just not visible.
Probably you need to remove SATA to initialize first, well your m.2 at least show up at BIOS to choose from.
I doubt it. But let me try after I get my screwdriver kit.

WRITING.TITLE: Directory hierarchies
WRITING.TEXT: import os import pandas as pd rootdir = "hashfolders" HASHES_TXT = "MD5Hash_1k.txt" if __name__ == '__main__': hashes = pd.read_csv(HASHES_TXT).values.flatten().tolist() name2hash = {} dirs2hash = {} counter = 0 # find directories until no subdirectories print("scanning for unique directories (innermost) names") for dirname, subdirnames, filenames in os.walk(rootdir): if len(subdirnames) == 0: splitted_name = os.path.split(dirname) innermost_dirname = os.path.split(dirname)[-1] # if the name is already mapped to a key, use it, otherwise hash it with the next key if innermost_dirname not in name2hash: name2hash[innermost_dirname] = hashes[counter] counter += 1 hash_output = ( splitted_name[0], name2hash[innermost_dirname] ) dirs2hash[dirname] = os.path.join(hash_output[0], hash_output[1]) for old_name, new_name in dirs2hash.items(): print("renaming {} to {}".format(old_name, new_name)) os.rename(old_name, new_name) I wrote the above script to rename all the innermost subfolder names to md5 hashed names. However, there're two directory hierarchies 1. hashfolders/cat\_id/obj\_id/ 2. hashfolders/cat\_id/obj\_id/var\_id/ For the 2nd hierarchy, I want it to hash the /var\_id/ folders but move them one level/directory above and remove the /obj\_id/ folder. For example, `hashfolders/cat_id/obj_id_01/var_id_01/` is renamed to `hashfolders/cat_id/0a7645498b7d895e1f0988b01524622f/` Any idea how can I do this in my code?
Hmm, getting an error: dir_hashes[var_id] = cat_id / name_hashes[var_id.name] TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for /: 'str' and 'str'
Yup, thanks. But now it's getting a 'FileExistsError' when it uses a same md5 name for a different folder. The idea is to assign a unique md5 name to each.
